docs.text: devotees of robert a . heinlein , be forewarned : paul verhoeven's starship troopers is less an adaptation of heinlein's novel than it is a literary satire .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the author's jingo-all-the-way militarism and his tendency to create plastic characters with plastic conflicts had me expecting a soulless , faceless parade of carnage from the film version .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and i suppose that's exactly what verhoeven delivers , with sometimes hilarious results .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: heinlein's basic motifs are so faithfully rendered that their flaws become a source of amusement , while their strengths become the stuff of high-energy entertainment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: outlining the plot of starship troopers is a fairly silly endeavor , since it's basically a big bug hunt . . . aliens in broad daylight .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sometime in the future , humanity is threatened by giant , malevolent insects which have evolved into twenty-foot-tall action figures ( arachnids with super-impaling spikes , beetles that spew forth lava , dragonflies with guillotine legs ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: among those who sign on to save the earth are a group of high school classmates from buenos aires : conflicted rich kid johnny rico ( casper van dien ) ; his math whiz girlfriend carmen ( denise richards ) ; dizzy ( dina meyer ) , who secretly carries a torch for johnny ; and carl ( neil patrick " doogie howser " harris ) , who not-so-secretly carries a torch for dizzy , and also has a talent for speaking telepathically to ferrets .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while carmen heads for flight school and carl joins military intelligence , johnny and dizzy become mobile infantry , their various battles intertwining with romantic sub-plots out of a third season episode from " beverly hills 90210 . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so if starship troopers is another movie where one-dimensional characters wade through trite situations on their way to killing a bunch of aliens , what makes it any better than , say , independence day , a movie where one-dimensional characters waded through trite situations on their way to killing a bunch of slightly different aliens ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for one thing , you sense that the film-makers are aware of the pulp nonsense they have as source material .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the very absence of major stars in the cast feels thematically appropriate , not just fiscally prudent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if starship troopers had been turned into a tv-movie , aaron spelling would have produced it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a story which requires emoting , not acting ; it's a prime time soap opera with big guns , played for all the dopey melodrama it's worth .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the no-name cast also plays into verhoeven's treatment of heinlein's most controversial conceit .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in this society , we learn , one can only be a full citizen after completing some sort of federal service , military for most .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: verhoeven pays the notion plenty of lip service , then proceeds to skewer it with brilliant mock recruitment ads ( named after the world war ii-era " why we fight " series ) in which youngsters are indoctrinated into the joys of firearms , or the pleasures of stomping cockroaches .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these characters really are just " fresh meat for the grinder , " as one character puts it , which makes their lack of familiarity all the more fitting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's not that starship troopers is anti-military , because it never treats the true horror of war as anything but a great big , violent video game .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , the characters are living the propaganda ( particularly johnny , who receives so many field promotions he may not remember his own rank by the time the film ends ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: verhoeven is actually having it both ways -- he's making fun of gung-ho boosterism even as he fires his fresh-faced recruits into battle on a gung-ho booster rocket of visual effects .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if that makes starship troopers hypocritical , at least it's enthusiastically staged hypocrisy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there may not be a person worth caring about in the whole film , but it moves like nobody's business .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: verhoeven stages some thrilling action sequences , sending swarms of bugs after the anonymous grunts then having various body parts strewn about the screen like landscaping .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is that rare special effects blockbuster which demonstrates a sense of pacing to match its budget ; i was caught up in the action enough of the time that i wasn't perpetually groaning over the absence of real human beings .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i wish i could find it in myself to work up more outrage over the callous way humans are dispatched in starship troopers , but it didn't work out that way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that would be punishing verhoeven for getting to the heart of his material .
docs.label: positive
